Parenting yourself was something I learned a couple of years ago. My children are grown and out of the nest but when I look back I see how I pushed myself too hard so I was always away and the when I came home I was too tired and not available for my them and their mother. I am 61 now and if you are reading this , trust me when I say being there for your family is the most important job you have in life. Be interested in their lives not just your own. It is key to how successful they will be later in their life.
Absolutely incredible advice about family.

Sam, you are ahead of your time in this political climate that is so behind the true times. Your book on abundance is spot on. The earth and its inhabitants are going through an ascension process now that requires us to think in terms of what we want for a loving and prosperous humanity and that means having abundance on all levels. We have to have a vision of what we want for it to manifest and not just let the powers that be dictate for us. Everything that is created starts as a thought. People are awakening in large numbers even though it may not look like it. The awakening is part of the chaos because the status quo and corruption cannot hold; it‚Äôs breaking and people like you are helping it to fall so that we can get on with building a better society for all. I know Scott spends a lot of time talking about American men but for those of us who live overseas, we see it very differently. We live in countries where men and women work together and raise kids together. They are human beings doing what needs to be do to live life. Gaming became a Thing more in the US than any place. Just get on with life. As my father said: 'Do the things you need to do to live life and keep doing that when you live with others' ... and he did just that. He made his bed, washed his clothes, ironed, shopped, cooked, cleaned the toilet, mopped the floor, vacuumed, went to work, tended the garden (he did the food, my mom did the flowers). Get on with Life and live it. One huge issue in the US is that people have said: 'Let kids be kids' whereas in most of the countries, kids learn the skills they will need as adults.
